list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor responsive text sizes
Convert `responsiveBodyLarge`, `responsiveBodyMedium`, `responsiveBodySmall`, `responsiveLabelLarge`, and `responsiveLabelSmall` to use scalable pixels (`.sp`) for all layouts (mobile, tablet, desktop).
This change removes hardcoded pixel values and ensures text scales consistently across different screen sizes and device pixel densities. Added comments indicate the approximate rendered font size.

task.summary:
feat: Stretch stats in mobile view
In the `StatsSection` widget, the `crossAxisAlignment` for the mobile layout's `Column` has been set to `CrossAxisAlignment.stretch`. This ensures that the statistics items fill the available width.

feat: Stretch stats in mobile view
In the `StatsSection` widget, the `crossAxisAlignment` for the mobile layout's `Column` has been set to `CrossAxisAlignment.stretch`. This ensures that the statistics items fill the available width.

Refactor social links layout in footer
Wrapped social links in `ResponsiveLayout` to adjust their orientation based on screen size. They now appear as a column on mobile and a row on tablet and desktop.

Refactor: Improve responsiveness of experience section
Refactors the experience section for better responsiveness across different screen sizes.
- Adjusts flex ratios for current and previous experience cards. - Implements responsive font sizes for the leadership philosophy card. - Tweaks spacing and text alignment within experience cards for improved layout. - Updates descriptive text for clarity.

Refactor responsive breakpoints
Update the screen size breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop layouts. The layout builder logic is also adjusted to match the new breakpoint values.

Refactor: Make nav bar responsive
- Use `responsive_sizer` for font and icon sizes in the navigation bar. - Adjust font sizes for the logo, nav links, and resume button based on screen size. - Update the terminal icon size to be responsive.

Refactor: Make nav bar responsive
- Use `responsive_sizer` for font and icon sizes in the navigation bar. - Adjust font sizes for the logo, nav links, and resume button based on screen size. - Update the terminal icon size to be responsive.

Refactor: Make nav bar responsive
- Use `responsive_sizer` for font and icon sizes in the navigation bar. - Adjust font sizes for the logo, nav links, and resume button based on screen size. - Update the terminal icon size to be responsive.
Refactor: Update text color values in AppColors

Make hero section responsive
Use responsive_sizer for font sizes in the hero section and code editor to ensure proper scaling across different screen sizes. Wrap the code editor's child in an `Expanded` widget to prevent overflow.

Refactor: Use responsive text extension for font sizes
Replaced `ResponsiveLayout` and `responsive_sizer` with a custom `responsiveBodyMedium` extension from `responsive_text.dart` to standardize and simplify responsive font sizing across widgets.

Refactor: Use responsive text extension for font sizes
Replaced `ResponsiveLayout` and `responsive_sizer` with a custom `responsiveBodyMedium` extension from `responsive_text.dart` to standardize and simplify responsive font sizing across widgets.

Make text responsive in WhoIsJonathan section
Introduced `responsive_sizer` and a custom `responsive_text` utility to adjust font sizes based on screen size. This enhances readability across mobile, tablet, and desktop layouts.

Refactor: Use responsiveBodySmall for font sizes
Replaced `responsiveBodyMedium` with `responsiveBodySmall` across several widgets to unify font sizing. Also, removed the unused `responsive_sizer` package and enabled soft wrap on a terminal text widget to prevent overflow.

Refactor responsive text sizes
Convert `responsiveBodyLarge`, `responsiveBodyMedium`, `responsiveBodySmall`, `responsiveLabelLarge`, and `responsiveLabelSmall` to use scalable pixels (`.sp`) for all layouts (mobile, tablet, desktop).
This change removes hardcoded pixel values and ensures text scales consistently across different screen sizes and device pixel densities. Added comments indicate the approximate rendered font size.

MESSAGE.value:
feat: Stretch stats in mobile view
In the `StatsSection` widget, the `crossAxisAlignment` for the mobile layout's `Column` has been set to `CrossAxisAlignment.stretch`. This ensures that the statistics items fill the available width.

Refactor social links layout in footer
Wrapped social links in `ResponsiveLayout` to adjust their orientation based on screen size. They now appear as a column on mobile and a row on tablet and desktop.

Refactor: Improve responsiveness of experience section
Refactors the experience section for better responsiveness across different screen sizes.
- Adjusts flex ratios for current and previous experience cards. - Implements responsive font sizes for the leadership philosophy card. - Tweaks spacing and text alignment within experience cards for improved layout. - Updates descriptive text for clarity.

Refactor responsive breakpoints
Update the screen size breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop layouts. The layout builder logic is also adjusted to match the new breakpoint values.

Refactor: Make nav bar responsive
- Use `responsive_sizer` for font and icon sizes in the navigation bar. - Adjust font sizes for the logo, nav links, and resume button based on screen size. - Update the terminal icon size to be responsive.
Refactor: Update text color values in AppColors

Make hero section responsive
Use responsive_sizer for font sizes in the hero section and code editor to ensure proper scaling across different screen sizes. Wrap the code editor's child in an `Expanded` widget to prevent overflow.

Refactor: Use responsive text extension for font sizes
Replaced `ResponsiveLayout` and `responsive_sizer` with a custom `responsiveBodyMedium` extension from `responsive_text.dart` to standardize and simplify responsive font sizing across widgets.

Make text responsive in WhoIsJonathan section
Introduced `responsive_sizer` and a custom `responsive_text` utility to adjust font sizes based on screen size. This enhances readability across mobile, tablet, and desktop layouts.

Refactor: Use responsiveBodySmall for font sizes
Replaced `responsiveBodyMedium` with `responsiveBodySmall` across several widgets to unify font sizing. Also, removed the unused `responsive_sizer` package and enabled soft wrap on a terminal text widget to prevent overflow.

Refactor responsive text sizes
Convert `responsiveBodyLarge`, `responsiveBodyMedium`, `responsiveBodySmall`, `responsiveLabelLarge`, and `responsiveLabelSmall` to use scalable pixels (`.sp`) for all layouts (mobile, tablet, desktop).
This change removes hardcoded pixel values and ensures text scales consistently across different screen sizes and device pixel densities. Added comments indicate the approximate rendered font size.

This change removes hardcoded pixel values and ensures text scales consistently across different screen sizes and device pixel densities. Added comments indicate the approximate rendered font size.
